Manifest stored in /meta-inf instead of /META-INF (which is not OSGI conformant).
In this case, Eclipse assumes the manifest is nonexistent and tries to generate one from plugin.xml (fragment.xml).
The plugin was thought to be a simple OSGI bundle, thus it has no plugin.xml. The result is a PluginConversionException (plugin.xml not found).
However this is slightly irritating, since the exception does not describe the real problem.
Can you post the error log?

Thanks.  Are you just asking for a better message in the exception cause?  For example, change "Could not find a plugin.xml or a fragment.xml in ..." to "Could not find a META-INF/MANIFEST.MF, plugin.xml or a fragment.xml in" or something else here?

Since the OSGI spec demands META-INF/MANIFEST.MF to be uppercase, a more specific exception message should be sufficient.
However, a really convenient solution would be to ignore the case in this situation. Partners/Customers of us have written bundles that come with uppercase, lowercase and even mixed case zip entries, the latter two producing this error.
On the contrary, I am aware that firstly this would not be spec conformant and secondly requires deeper changes to the current implementation, which uses ZipFile.getEntry(..) to retrieve the manifest. And there is no method in ZipFile which ignores the path.

I think it is your decision, I will accept anything :-)
I updated the error message to indicate the missing META-INF/MANIFEST.MF file.
